title: FPS issue, weird in-game noises ( annoying lag type noise, scatchy )
body:
Here is my system info:
System Manufacturer:    LENOVO
Processor:    Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-5500U CPU @ 2.40GHz, 2401 Mhz, 2 Core(s), 4 Logical Processor(s)
Installed RAM:  8 GB
System Type:  64-bit operating system, x64-based processor
GeForce: 840M

So last week my fps was around 198, I decided near the end of that week that I wanted to download steam, so I downloaded steam and I also bought the game Total War: Warhammer. Which if you know the total war series you know they take up a good size of storage. Well I wouldn't think this would have affected me? But a day later I noticed something was very different...I hopped on to league with my pals, we entered a match but the game froze 10 mins into the game? So I turned off my laptop and rejoined the que only to freeze again a minute later? I repeated the process but went into a custom game and my fps was in the low 60s unwavering? A weird lag scratchy noise was being omitted from the in game noise and the frames were just garbage.  So I uninstalled league and re-installed it but it still happened? So I wiped my computer, wiped any files (barely any), re-installed windows 10, re installed league, and re installed steam (Warhammer as well), I go to log into league to see in a custom game if the fps is still down in the 60s and it is!? I've checked all my drivers, I have re-installed league, I have uninstalled steam and Warhammer off my cpu, what is going on? Another note my Warhammer was working fine this whole time so I don't know why league just jumps in the dumpster all of a sudden???? Any help would be much appreciated thank you!

replies.body:
Did you install some windows 10 updates recently? We've been hearing from some players that the Windows 10 anniversary updates are causing these types of issues for League. If so, I recommend [rolling back or uninstalling](http://www.howtogeek.com/235474/how-to-roll-back-builds-and-uninstall-updates-on-windows-10/) those updates to see if anything changes.

Let me know if that worked or not.
Targon I fixed problem, the solution is turning off game dvr in the xbox app on windows 10, after that the bug is fixed just did that and my fps is back at 310!
Yes, right before I re-installed windows, I updated my windows 10 to windows 10 anniversary, I will roll back my windows and let you know!

Also I think I updated Windows because league was already acting like this or vice versa I can't remember rn? But I just uninstalled the updates and restarted my comp but the problem still occurs on league so I'm redownloading Windows 10 rn and then will install league again.
Or I might just reinstall league first
